tourName: India small group tour for families
generalInfo: Embark on an extraordinary family adventure through the vibrant heart of India, starting in the bustling metropolis of Delhi! This 10-day journey, crafted especially for families with children, seamlessly blends iconic landmarks, thrilling wildlife encounters, and authentic cultural experiences. Your adventure begins in Delhi, where you'll dive into the city's vibrant energy and rich history. Explore the magnificent Red Fort, a powerful symbol of Mughal rule, and marvel at the architectural grandeur of Jama Masjid, one of India's largest mosques. Wander through the labyrinthine alleys of Chandni Chowk, a shopper's paradise brimming with colorful textiles, aromatic spices, and tempting street food. Here, you'll embark on a delicious food tour, sampling local delicacies and discovering the unique flavors of Delhi. Hop aboard a traditional rickshaw for a leisurely ride through the city's vibrant tapestry of life. From the urban bustle of Delhi, journey to Agra to witness the sunrise paint the Taj Mahal in a breathtaking spectrum of colors. This iconic monument to love is a must-see for every visitor to India. Next, venture into the rural charm of Dolphur, where you'll experience the warmth and hospitality of village life. Engage with local families, witness traditional crafts, and gain a deeper understanding of India's rich cultural heritage. Continue your adventure in the wilds of Ranthambore National Park, a haven for India's magnificent tigers. Embark on thrilling game drives, hoping to catch a glimpse of these elusive creatures along with leopards, sloth bears, and a myriad of other fascinating wildlife. Immerse yourselves in the vibrant culture of Rajasthan as you explore the "Pink City" of Jaipur. Wander through bustling bazaars, where the air is filled with the rhythmic sounds of craftsmen at work and the enticing aromas of traditional cuisine. Marvel at the astronomical wonders of Jantar Mantar, a unique collection of ancient instruments that will leave you starstruck. And delve into the grandeur of Amber Fort, a hilltop palace straight out of a fairytale, with its intricate carvings, secret passageways, and breathtaking views. Along the way, engage with local communities, learn traditional crafts like block printing, and savor the flavors of authentic Indian cuisine during a home-cooked dinner with a local family. With a balanced itinerary that blends activity and leisure, this tour promises an enriching and enjoyable experience for all ages. Create lasting family memories while exploring India's rich tapestry of history, culture, and natural beauty. This is an adventure that will ignite the imagination and leave a lasting impression on every member of your family. This tour has been arranged specifically for those travelling with children aged from 6 to 16 years (minimum age 6) - child discounts are available.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Delhi, transfer to hotel included Once you arrive in Delhi, you'll be met by one of our local staff, who will transfer your hotel. Once you're settled in, we'll run through the tour itinerary for the next few days, brief you on the local area and arrange a time to collect you tomorrow. OVERNIGHT

Exploring Delhi, Rickshaw Ride & Street Food Tasting Your day starts with a morning tour of India's capital, New Delhi. Built on the banks of the Yamuna river, New Delhi is a beautiful blend of a historical past and a vibrant present. We start at India Gate in the centre of New Delhi, a 42-metre high "Arc-de-Triomphe" like archway, a war memorial built to commemorate the 82,000 soldiers who partook in the undivided Indian Army. We'll drive past various government buildings such as the President's Palace and the Parliament of India, before passing Humayun's Tomb - a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and the Bangla Sahab Gurudwara Sikh Temple. We'll stop at Connaught Place Station and join the locals on the metro to Old Delhi where we'll walk through one of the oldest and busiest markets in Old Delhi, Chandni Chowk, before exploring the narrow streets of Chawri Bazar which specialises in selling brass, copper and paper products. Throughout the afternoon our guide will also introduce you to the wide range of street food snacks and delicacies so you can get your first authentic taste of the delicious and varied Indian cuisine. Our walking tour will also take in a rickshaw ride and the Jama Masjid mosque, one of the largest in India. OVERNIGHT

Head to Agra. Mughal Heritage Walk. First glimpse of the Taj Mahal We head to Agra this morning, home of the famous Taj Mahal. Once you've checked in into your hotel, we'll spend the afternoon on a Mughal Heritage Walk through the ancient village of Kachhpura and surrounding farmland on the banks of the Yamuna River across from the Taj Mahal and Red Fort. This walk has been designed by a local NGO and helps support the local community through employment and new infrastructure. During the walk one of the villagers will give a guide to their village life, the layout of their homes, with living, cooking & religious areas, the farming done, and the local cottage industry for leather shoe making which helps Agra export shoes all over the world. You'll also see some lesser known but important Mughal era monuments. Finally today we'll stroll around the park at Mehtab Bagh - originally built by Emperor Babur as the last in a series of 11 parks on the Yamuna River's east bank, before taking in the magnificent sight of the Taj Mahal at sunset. A special evening option is available today, where you can join a Hindu family for a Vegetarian Thali cooking lesson and meal. OVERNIGHT

Taj Mahal sunrise. Village School visit. Drive to Dolphur, Village exploration Today promises to be an unforgettable journey through history and culture! We'll rise early to witness the breathtaking Taj Mahal bathed in the soft hues of dawn. This magnificent monument, a testament to eternal love, was built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal. As the sun ascends, watch the marble façade transform, reflecting a spectrum of colors that will leave you awestruck. Imagine the 22 years of dedicated craftsmanship and the 20,000 artisans who brought this wonder to life. After a leisurely breakfast, we'll delve into the heart of Agra, visiting a local school where your children can interact with Indian students their own age. It's a wonderful opportunity to bridge cultures and gain a firsthand understanding of the similarities and differences in education. Perhaps they'll share games, songs, or stories, forging connections that will last a lifetime. Our adventure continues as we journey to the charming town of Dolphur. Here, we'll immerse ourselves in the rhythm of rural Indian life. Imagine strolling through bustling markets, witnessing traditional crafts being practiced, and engaging in conversations with friendly locals. This authentic experience will offer a glimpse into the rich tapestry of life in an Indian village, far removed from the usual tourist trails. OVERNIGHT

Abhaneri Step Well Viist. Ranthambore - Home of the Bengal Tiger. Bidding farewell to Dolphur, we embark on a journey to Ranthambore National Park, a haven for wildlife enthusiasts. But first, prepare to be amazed by the Abhaneri Step Well, an architectural wonder that descends 13 stories into the earth. Its 3,500 steps create a mesmerizing geometric pattern, and you might recognize this incredible site from "The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel"! Ranthambore National Park, named after the majestic fort within its boundaries, is renowned as one of India's premier tiger reserves. Established in 1973, the park plays a crucial role in protecting these magnificent creatures and mitigating human-wildlife conflict. Keep your cameras ready – a thrilling tiger sighting might be just around the corner! OVERNIGHT

Morning and Afternoon Shared Canter Safari rides (keep your eyes peeled for Tigers!!!) Prepare for an exhilarating adventure as we embark on an early morning game drive into the heart of Ranthambore National Park! This is your chance to witness India's magnificent tigers in their natural habitat. But don't forget to keep your eyes peeled for other incredible wildlife – leopards, sloth bears, hyenas, and a myriad of other fascinating creatures call this park home. We'll journey deep into the park aboard a shared open-backed canter, allowing for unparalleled views of the diverse landscape and its inhabitants. Our exploration will also lead us to the ancient Ranthambore Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site perched atop a 200-meter high hill. Imagine the history echoing within its walls as you take in the panoramic views of the park. And the excitement doesn't end there! In the afternoon, we'll embark on a second game drive, maximizing your chances of encountering the elusive Bengal tiger. Get ready for an unforgettable day of wildlife encounters and breathtaking scenery. OVERNIGHT

To Jaipur, the capital of Rajasthan. Visit the Amber Fort Get ready for an adventure fit for a Maharaja! Today, we journey to Jaipur, the captivating capital of Rajasthan. Known as the "Pink City," Jaipur is a treasure trove of history, culture, and vibrant colors. After a leisurely morning, we'll step back in time at the magnificent Amber Fort. Imagine a palace built for royalty, with shimmering marble, secret passageways, and stunning views from its hilltop perch. Kids will love exploring this real-life castle and imagining the people who once lived within its walls. It's so grand, some even say it rivals the Great Wall of China! Get ready to be amazed by its beauty and learn the fascinating stories behind this ancient wonder. OVERNIGHT

Jaipur City Tour, Gemstone Cutting and Block printing workshop. Dinner with a local family Get ready for a day of wonder and discovery in Jaipur! For the early birds, there's an incredible opportunity to soar above the city in a hot air balloon. Imagine drifting over magnificent palaces, majestic forts, and sparkling lakes as the sun paints the sky with vibrant colors – a truly unforgettable experience! Later, we'll dive into the heart of Jaipur, exploring its rich history and vibrant culture. Prepare to be amazed by the Jantar Mantar, a fascinating collection of astronomical instruments that look like something out of a science fiction movie! We'll also wander through the City Palace, a sprawling complex of courtyards, gardens, and exquisitely decorated buildings where kings once ruled. In the afternoon, get ready for a sensory adventure in Jaipur's bustling bazaars! Imagine vibrant colors, enticing aromas, and the rhythmic sounds of craftsmen at work. We'll witness the magic of traditional crafts like jewelry making, silverwork, and textile weaving. And for a hands-on experience, we'll even participate in a block printing workshop and learn about the art of gemstone cutting. To top it all off, we'll enjoy a delicious home-cooked dinner with a local family, learning the secrets of Indian cuisine during a fun and interactive cooking demonstration. It's the perfect way to experience the warmth and hospitality of Jaipur! OVERNIGHT

Return to Delhi. Free afternoon (optional visit to the Akshardam Temple) We'll say goodbye to Jaipur and drive back to Delhi. Once we arrive in Delhi, you'll be transferred to your hotel and have some free time in the afternoon for last minute shopping or exploration. You could also join our optional tour to the Hindu Akshardam Temple. OVERNIGHT

All good things come to an end! Airport transfer included You have some free time to buy any gifts for your loved ones back home before we transfer you to the airport to catch your flight back home. Additional half day tours are available this morning if you have a later flight, and extension options are also available. OVERNIGHT
